name: dart-convert
comment:
Encoders and decoders for converting between different data representations, including JSON and UTF-8.

In addition to converters for common data representations, this library provides support for implementing converters in a way which makes them easy to chain and to use with streams.

The dart:convert library works in both web apps and command-line apps. To use it:

import 'dart:convert';

Two commonly used converters are the top-level instances of dart-convert.JsonCodec and dart-convert.Utf8Codec, named JSON and UTF8, respectively.

JSON is a simple text format for representing structured objects and collections. The JSON encoder/decoder transforms between strings and object structures, such as lists and maps, using the JSON format.

UTF-8 is a common variable-width encoding that can represent every character in the Unicode character set. The UTF-8 encoder/decoder transforms between Strings and bytes.

Converters are often used with streams to transform the data that comes through the stream as it becomes available. The following code uses two converters. The first is a UTF-8 decoder, which converts the data from bytes to UTF-8 as it's read from a file, The second is an instance of dart-convert.LineSplitter, which splits the data on newline boundaries.

int lineNumber = 1;
Stream<List<int>> stream = new File('quotes.txt').openRead();

stream.transform(UTF8.decoder)
      .transform(const LineSplitter())
      .listen((line) {
        if (showLineNumbers) {
          stdout.write('${lineNumber++} ');
        }
        stdout.writeln(line);
      });

See the documentation for the dart-convert.Codec and dart-convert.Converter classes for information about creating your own converters.

UTF8.name: UTF8
UTF8.comment:
An instance of the default implementation of the dart-convert.Utf8Codec.

This instance provides a convenient access to the most common UTF-8 use cases.

Examples:

var encoded = UTF8.encode("Îñţérñåţîöñåļîžåţîờñ");
var decoded = UTF8.decode([0x62, 0x6c, 0xc3, 0xa5, 0x62, 0xc3, 0xa6,
                           0x72, 0x67, 0x72, 0xc3, 0xb8, 0x64]);

LATIN1.name: LATIN1
LATIN1.comment:
An instance of the default implementation of the dart-convert.Latin1Codec.

This instance provides a convenient access to the most common ISO Latin 1 use cases.

Examples:

var encoded = LATIN1.encode("blåbærgrød");
var decoded = LATIN1.decode([0x62, 0x6c, 0xe5, 0x62, 0xe6,
                             0x72, 0x67, 0x72, 0xf8, 0x64]);

JSON.name: JSON
JSON.comment:
An instance of the default implementation of the dart-convert.JsonCodec.

This instance provides a convenient access to the most common JSON use cases.

Examples:

var encoded = JSON.encode([1, 2, { "a": null }]);
var decoded = JSON.decode('["foo", { "bar": 499 }]');

ASCII.name: ASCII
ASCII.comment:
An instance of the default implementation of the dart-convert.AsciiCodec.

This instance provides a convenient access to the most common ASCII use cases.

Examples:

var encoded = ASCII.encode("This is ASCII!");
var decoded = ASCII.decode([0x54, 0x68, 0x69, 0x73, 0x20, 0x69, 0x73,
                            0x20, 0x41, 0x53, 0x43, 0x49, 0x49, 0x21]);

class.name: Utf8Decoder
class.preview: This class converts UTF-8 code units (lists of unsigned 8-bit integers) to a string.

class.name: Utf8Encoder
class.preview: This class converts strings to their UTF-8 code units (a list of unsigned 8-bit integers).

class.name: Utf8Codec
class.preview: A dart-convert.Utf8Codec encodes strings to utf-8 code units (bytes) and decodes UTF-8 code units to strings.

class.name: StringConversionSinkMixin
class.preview: This class provides a mixin for converters that need to accept String inputs.

class.name: StringConversionSinkBase
class.preview: This class provides a base-class for converters that need to accept String inputs.

class.name: ClosableStringSink
class.preview: A dart-convert.ClosableStringSink extends the dart-core.StringSink interface by adding a close method.

class.name: StringConversionSink
class.preview: This class provides an interface for converters to efficiently transmit String data.

class.name: LineSplitter
class.preview: This class splits dart-core.String values into individual lines.

class.name: Latin1Decoder
class.preview: This class converts Latin-1 bytes (lists of unsigned 8-bit integers) to a string.

class.name: Latin1Encoder
class.preview: This class converts strings of only ISO Latin-1 characters to bytes.

class.name: Latin1Codec
class.preview: A LatinCodec encodes strings to ISO Latin-1 (aka ISO-8859-1) bytes and decodes Latin-1 bytes to strings.

class.name: JsonDecoder
class.preview: This class parses JSON strings and builds the corresponding objects.

class.name: JsonEncoder
class.preview: This class converts JSON objects to strings.

class.name: JsonCodec
class.preview: A dart-convert.JsonCodec encodes JSON objects to strings and decodes strings to JSON objects.

class.name: Encoding
class.preview: Open-ended Encoding enum.

class.name: Converter
class.preview: A dart-convert.Converter converts data from one representation into another.

class.name: Codec
class.preview: A dart-convert.Codec encodes and (if supported) decodes data.

class.name: ChunkedConversionSink
class.preview: A dart-convert.ChunkedConversionSink is used to transmit data more efficiently between two converters during chunked conversions.

class.name: ByteConversionSinkBase
class.preview: This class provides a base-class for converters that need to accept byte inputs.

class.name: ByteConversionSink
class.preview: The dart-convert.ByteConversionSink provides an interface for converters to efficiently transmit byte data.

class.name: AsciiEncoder
class.preview: This class converts strings of only ASCII characters to bytes.

class.name: AsciiCodec
class.preview: An dart-convert.AsciiCodec allows encoding strings as ASCII bytes and decoding ASCII bytes to strings.

error.name: JsonCyclicError
error.preview: Reports that an object could not be stringified due to cyclic references.

error.name: JsonUnsupportedObjectError
error.preview: Error thrown by JSON serialization if an object cannot be serialized.
